metadata.title: CVE-2019-8658 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue isfixed in iOS 12.4, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, tvOS 12.4, watchOS 5.3, Safari12.1.2, iTunes for Windows 12.9.6, iCloud for Windows 7.13, iCloud forWindows 10.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead touniversal cross site scripting.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
